resources.string: CALCULATIONS ARE BASED ON AGE, WEIGHT, HEIGHT AND GENDER

Providing your age and weight will help\ncalculate more accurate results
Both level and incline are controlled by the user. Increase\n or decrease levels at any time during your workout.
Level is controlled by the user. Increase or decrease levels at any time during your workout.

Level: This program follows a triangle or pyramid type of 
gradual progression from approximately 10% of maximum 
effort (the level that you choose before starting this 
program) up to a maximum effort which lasts for 10% of the
 total workout time, then a gradual regression of Level back
to approximately 10% of maximum effort.

Incline: This deck elevation is a more gradual and sustained 
progression.Maximum elevation is in the 
middle of the workout and lasts for 10% of the duration.

Level: This program follows a triangle or pyramid type of gradual progression from approximately 10% of maximum effort (the level that you choose before starting this program) up to a maximum effort which lasts for 10% of the total workout time, then a gradual regression of level back to approximately 10% of maximum effort.

Level: This program follows a fast progression up to the 
maximum level (default or user input level) that is sustained 
for 2/3 of the workout. This program will challenge your
ability to sustain your energy output for an extended period
of time.

Incline: The deck elevation is a fast and sustained 
progression up to the maximum value (default or user 
input) for 90% of the workout duration.

Level: This program follows a fast progression up to the maximum level (default or user input level) that is sustained for 2/3 of the workout. This program will challenge your ability to sustain your energy output for an extended period of time.

Level: This program presents a fast progression up to near 
maximum level (default or user input level). It has slight
fluctuations up and down to allow your heart rate to elevate,
and then recover repeatedly,before beginning a cool down.
This will build up your heart muscle and increase
blood flow and lung capacity.

Incline: The elevation in this program is moderate. There are 
several elevation spikes at different points of the workout. 
Segments 4, 9, and 14 are maximum elevation for this 
program.

Level: This program presents a fast progression up to near 
maximum level (default or user input level). It has slight
fluctuations up and down to allow your heart rate to elevate,
and then recover repeatedly,before beginning a cool down.
This will build up your heart muscle and increase
blood flow and lung capacity.

Level: This program has a gradual progression of level up to
100% of maximum effort that is sustained for 25% of 
workout duration. This will help build strength and muscular 
endurance in the lower body and glutes. A brief cool down 
follows.

Incline: There is a rapid climb to a moderate, sustained 
elevation that lasts the majority of the workout length.

Level: This program has a gradual progression of level up to
100% of maximum effort that is sustained for 25% of 
workout duration. This will help build strength and muscular 
endurance in the lower body and glutes. A brief cool down 
follows.

Level: This program takes you through high levels
of intensity followed by recovery periods of low intensity.
This program utilizes and develops your “Fast Twitch”
muscle fibers which are used when performing tasks that
are intense and short in duration.

Incline: Elevation will spike in different segments; this means
that all of your lower extremity muscles will be equally
challenged throughout this program.

During the program you will perform short bursts of high intensity sprinting followed by short rest periods. HIIT is a fully customizable interval training program. You can enter the number of intervals, time of each interval Sprint and Rest periods and the work intensity of the levels.
Choose your target heart rate and follow level\nrecommendations. The machine will attempt to keep you\nwithin 5 beats of your target.
Choose your target heart rate and follow level\nrecommendations. The machine will attempt to keep you\nwithin 5 beats of your target.

You will create the desired level and incline for each 
of the 20 segments of the program using the pop out 
keyboard on this screen.

after the program has started, you still have the ability 
of changing these levels whenever you desire.

You will create the desired level for each of the 20 segments
of the program using the pop out keyboard on this screen.

After the program has started, you still have the ability of changing this level whenever you desire.

Both LEVEL and Incline are controlled by the user. Increase or
decrease levels at any time during your workout.

The Track Display will set the distance of 1 Lap to 5 kilometers
(metric) or 3.1 miles (standard measurement).

Both LEVEL and Incline are controlled by the user. Increase or
decrease levels at any time during your workout.

The Track Display will set the distance of 1 Lap to 10 kilometers
(metric) or 6.2 miles (standard measurement).
A timed 1.5 mile run. You control the speed manually.
A timed 2 mile run. You control the speed manually.
A timed 1.5 mile run. You control the speed manually.

The Gerkin protocol, also known as the fireman’s protocol,
is a sub maximal VO2 (volume of oxygen) test. The test will
increase speed and elevation alternately until you reach 85%
of your Max heart rate. The time it takes for you to reach 85%
determines the test score (VO2 Max).

Note: Use a heart rate strap for better results.
A timed 3 mile run. You control the speed manually.
A timed 1.5 mile run. You control the speed manually.
A timed 1.5 mile run. You control the speed manually.

Connect your device to the same WiFi
network as the equipment. Scan the
QR code or search for ‘SPIRIT
Mirroring’ app in Google Play on your
device and download it. 

In the app, select the SPIRIT device,
then press ‘Start Mirroring’.

code or search for ‘SPIRIT
Mirroring’ app in Google
Play on your device and
download it. In the app,
select the SPIRIT device,
then press ‘Start Mirroring’.

指示器的顏色只能設置成@color/colorID or #000000
請先調用setIndicator()方法來設置指示器
Banner setAdapter() 參數不能為空
你還沒有調用 setAdapter() 方法
Program has been successfully \nsaved to Templates
To share your workout data with the SPIRIT app, link your \nprofile to your SPIRIT app account. \nScan the QR code and follow further instructions.
To create a template, choose a default program, adjust its settings, complete it and save it.
Here you can manage your favorite programs, after you choose which you like the most.
Here you can check out your latest workout records, after you complete the first workout.

Scan the QR code 
or search for SPIRIT+
in App Store or Google
Play to download
the SPIRIT+ app.

Scan the QR code with the
SPIRIT+ app to link your
profile to the SPIRIT+ account
and sync your workout data.

Use the SPIRIT+ app to create
an account, then scan the QR
code with the app to sync
your profile and workout data.
With the Display Mode off, the machine\n will go to sleep after several minutes without using.
With the Display Mode on, the machine\n will not go to sleep.
